double_jeopardy_round: ALL THE LYRICS IN THE SONG

(1, 1).clue: Rosa Parks changed history in 1955 when she refused to give up her seat to a white person on a bus in this city

(2, 1).clue: This sign of the zodiac shares its name with 13 popes

(4, 1).clue: Mir was a third generation Russian one of these spacecraft & it lasted for 15 years

(5, 1).clue: Mary, who was "highly favoured" according to Gabriel

(6, 1).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Walt Disney Archives in Burbank, CA.)  It was tiaras all around in this Anne Hathaway sequel--one for Mia & one for her cat, Fat Louie; the yellow gems resemble pears because the fictional country of Genovia is famous for them

(1, 2).clue: Alabama claims the USA's oldest of these pre-Lenten celebrations, & moon pies are more typical than beads on the floats

(2, 2).clue: Add an "N" to the end of this sign & you get a type of animal

(3, 2).clue: ...of the nursery rhyme about Jack Sprat

(4, 2).clue: This term for vehicles like those used in the Mercury program sounds like a small dose of medicine

(6, 2).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from the Walt Disney Archives in Burbank, CA.)  The 11-foot long miniature of this submarine from "20,000 Leagues Under the Sea" had a working motor & weighed 1,000 pounds when rigged for filming

(1, 3).clue: Past KKK membership didn't stop Alabama's Hugo Black when he was appointed to this body in 1937

(2, 3).clue: This sign anagrams to what pepper & cinnamon are

(4, 3).clue: The first stage of a rocket

(6, 3).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from the Walt Disney Archives in Burbank, CA.)  "Pirates of the Caribbean" props include the dead man's chest, Jack's compass, & a medallion of stolen Aztec gold cursed due to the greed of this Spanish conquistador

(1, 4).clue: The August 1864 Battle of this body of water helped the Union enforce the blockade of the Confederacy

(2, 4).clue: If your mother was in labor on Labor Day, this is your sign

(4, 4).clue: This 2-word term for possibly alien spacecraft was 1st used after a pilot reported seeing 9 of them near Mt. Rainier in 1947

(5, 4).clue: Mavis Nicholson, who got used to late nights

(6, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Walt Disney Archives in Burbank, CA.)  There are openings in the side of the overcoat worn by Mary Poppins so that thin cables could be inserted to magically lift this actress, giving her the illusion of flight

(1, 5).clue: In 1812 this Shawnee leader came to Alabama to convince the Creek tribes to join the British against the Americans

(2, 5).clue: The name of this sign begins with the 19th letter of the Greek alphabet

(3, 5).clue: ...of the Preamble to the U.S. Constitution

(4, 5).clue: Like the Cassini around Saturn, this type of spacecraft by definition doesn't land, but circles a planet instead

(5, 5).clue: The former Edith Bolling, a First Lady

(6, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from the Walt Disney Archives in Burbank, CA.)  A fictional ring once owned by Lucrezia Borgia that bore the inscription "in canis corpore transmuto" turns Tommy Kirk into this title canine

(1, 1).clue: It's Europe's largest monarchy in area & stretches the farthest south

(2, 1).clue: My old favorite one of these, like the classic model from Red Ryder!  I bet it still shoots

(3, 1).clue: Na na na's aside, it's the sole lyric in the TV theme here

(4, 1).clue: It's the 2-letter abbreviation for a flow of electric charge that doesn't change direction

(5, 1).clue: Raymond Chandler wrote, "You were dead, you were sleeping" this, the title of a detective classic

(6, 1).clue: A clown loses his "Z" & becomes a shout of disapproval

(1, 2).clue: Prince Willem-Alexander of this country beat Britain's Prince William to kingship

(2, 2).clue: This Hamilton Beach device with big mouth extractor; I never did buy all those oranges & carrots

(3, 2).clue: This "Punk" electronic group had nothing to say in a 1997 song except "Around the world"

(4, 2).clue: Rheostats & potentiometers are types of these devices that oppose the flow of current in electrical circuits

(5, 2).clue: This lawyer first appeared in Erle Stanley Gardner's "The Case of the Velvet Claws" & you bet he won that case

(6, 2).clue: Lose the "Z" from an Eastern European ruling title & you get a mode of transport

(1, 3).clue: This country no longer crowns its king; the royal regalia is on display in Trondheim

(2, 3).clue: Wow!  I remember this year of the headline seen here as if it were yesterday

(3, 3).clue: Take a shot at the lone lyric in this song

(4, 3).clue: The 2012 merger of Duke & Progress created the USA's largest of these "useful" entities providing electric power

(5, 3).clue: Chapter 4 of this classic of detective fiction is "The Black Bird"

(6, 3).clue: Take the "Z" from several ciphers & you get a Greek god

(1, 4).clue: Philippe, seen here, took over as this country's king in 2013

(2, 4).clue: I wrote my own songs for about an hour on my Martin X series this instrument

(3, 4).clue: In 1975 Van McCoy topped the charts demanding, "Do it!  Do" this "quick" dance (repeatedly)

(4, 4).clue: This electromagnetic force that drives a current around a circuit is abbreviated emf

(5, 4).clue: James M. Cain really delivered with this first novel of his, which actually isn't about the mail

(6, 4).clue: Oy, I could just take the "Z" off the end of a word from Yiddish meaning "to burst" & get the story of a book or movie

(1, 5).clue: This current monarchy's Bernadotte Dynasty derives from one of Napoleon's top military men

(2, 5).clue: I loved this scientist's cradle; I used to spend hours just watching it go back & forth

(3, 5).clue: We remember this Minnesota trio whose name means "do you remember" & their song whose full lyrics are "New day rising"

(4, 5).clue: The law named for this 18th century French physicist is the electrical analogue to the law of gravity

(6, 5).clue: Take the "Z" out of a word meaning "to stun" or "to take aback" & you get a magical word used in fantasy books

(0, 0).clue: This word dates back to the 19th century & referred to what the sun did to roofless seating
